title: The Fed Is Overindebted
text:
Behind closed doors, the report is already making the rounds in expert circles: if you follow the rules of sound commercial accounting, the United States Federal Reserve (Fed) has lost its equity and is, as common language would have it, bankrupt. What happened?
During spring 2020 (i.e., in a period of extremely low interest rates), the Fed purchased large amounts of government bonds and mortgage bonds to support the economy and financial markets during the covid crisis.
The Fed paid for the purchases by issuing vast amounts of new central bank money. This has created an enormous â€œmoney surplusâ€ in the US interbank market, where banks lend money to one another. It is exactly in this market where the interest rates for all other credit markets are determined.
However, the excess money supply now exerts strong downward pressure on the interbank interest rates. Since this is not desirable from a monetary policy point of viewâ€”after all, the Fed is raising the key interest rate with the intention of making interbank credit more expensive, slowing down economic growth, and lowering inflationâ€”the Fedâ€™s Open Market Committee has decided to pay interest on the excess balances that the banks hold at the Fed.
This interest rate is currently 5.15 percent. This is close to the Fedâ€™s official key interest rate, which is currently between 5.00 and 5.25Â percent. In doing so, the Fed has set an interest rate limit in the interbank money market: no bank can lend its excess money supply for less than 5.15 percent if it gets this rate from the Fed.
In addition, the Fed grants â€œprivileged nonbanksâ€ the opportunity to conclude so-called reverse repurchase agreements with the Fedâ€”this select group includes asset managers, investment companies, pension funds, and others. This agreement allows them to transfer the balances they and their customers do not need to the Fed â€œovernightâ€ in exchange for interest-bearing securities. In return, they earn an interest rate of 5.05 percent, slightly below, but still close to, the minimum interest rate on the interbank market.
While this means that the Fed has full control over the interest rates in the money market, it is committed to making interest payments that are higher than the interest payments it receives on its securities portfolio. Since the Fed has been paying more interest than it collects for some time now, a massive negative interest result has built up on the Fedâ€™s balance sheet. It is recorded as a balance sheet liability. The usual US Treasury retained earnings, which are positive under normal circumstances, were negative $54.5 billion as of April 12, 2023 (or negative $44.2 billion on a consolidated basis).
If, however, a book entry that the Fed shows on the liability side of its balance sheet (i.e., under its liabilities) has a negative sign, this means nothing other than that it reduces the overall debt. One can rightly become suspicious here: this accounting practice is hardly compatible with truth and clarity when it comes to balance sheet accounting. Rather, it obscures the fact that the Fedâ€™s debt has effectively eaten away its reported equity, which was just $42.2 billion at the time. In other words, the Fedâ€™s liabilities are greater than its assets; in commercial accounting terms, this means â€œoverindebtedness.â€
It is worth noting that the Fedâ€™s book loss would be much larger if it were to report on its balance sheet the debt securities it purchases at market values (â€œmark-to-marketâ€) rather than at historical cost. By the way, it is the Fedâ€™s interest-rate-hiking spree that has security prices plummeting.
The Fed currently holds around $8.5 trillion in debt securities on its balance sheet. A price drop of just, letâ€™s say, 5 percent on this debt portfolio would result in an accounting loss (an â€œunrealized lossâ€) of $425 billion, reducing the Fedâ€™s equity capital by the same amount. (It should be noted here that if the Fed held the securities to maturity and the borrowers repaid them in full, the accounting loss would disappear by maturity.)
Any conventional company would be in dire straits under these circumstances. (By the way, failing to report a loss would be a punishable offense in many countries.) However, the Fed, like any other central bank, is not a conventional company. Rather, it has the state monopoly of money production, which makes it truly special.
The central bank can produce the money with which it needs to pay off its liabilities at any time and in any amount. However, a central bank cannot become insolvent like a traditional company. In fact, it could continue to operate even if its equity were depleted (i.e., if it were zero or negative, which is recorded on the assets side of its balance sheet).
Of course, the Fedâ€™s lack of equity could be remedied. This would be the case, for instance, if the US Treasury transferred newly issued government bonds to the Fed for free. The Fedâ€™s assets would increase, so the Fedâ€™s equity would increase if and when its liabilities remained the same.
The gold reserves on the Fedâ€™s balance sheet could also be revalued. Since the early 1970s, the Fedâ€™s 261.5 million gold troy ounces have been valued at $42.22 per troy ounce, equivalent to $11.04 billion. At current prices, however, the gold on the Fedâ€™s balance sheet has a market value of approximately $520 billion. That said, the revaluation of the Fedâ€™s gold could produce a revaluation gain of around $510 billionâ€”and bolster Fed equity accordingly.
While such a â€œcooking the booksâ€ could indeed â€œsaveâ€ the Fedâ€™s balance sheet, it doesnâ€™t mean investors wouldnâ€™t become concerned and have doubts about the whole US dollar construct. If the Fed has already run out of equity, what must the situation be like in the commercial banking sector? Also, if its balance sheet is already overstretched, will the Fed still be in a position to function as a â€œlender of last resortâ€ in the next crisis?
The Fedâ€™s balance sheet, in which liabilities exceed assets, is a red flag. Investors could lose confidence in the reliability and value of the US dollar and all currencies based on it. Who could blame investors if that eventually happened? In fact, the Fedâ€™s negative equity is just another sign of the growing trouble in the worldâ€™s fiat money regime dominated by the US dollar.

title: World Food Prices Rising Again â€“ UN
text:
The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations reported on Friday that global food prices grew in April for the first time in a year.Â 
The price index, which tracks the most globally traded food commodities, averaged 127.2 points last month, compared to 126.5 for March.
â€œThe slight rebound in the FFPI (FAO Food Price Index) in April was led by a steep increase in the sugar price index, along with an upturn in the meat price index, while the cereals, dairy and vegetable oil price indices continued to drop,â€Â the FAO said.
According to the report, the sugar price index soared 17.6% from March, hitting its highest level since October 2011. The rise was reportedly linked to concerns over tighter supplies following downward revisions to production forecasts for India and China, along with lower-than-expected output in Thailand and the European Union.
The meat price index was up 1.3% from March, while dairy prices fell 1.7%. Vegetable oil prices were also down 1.3%, marking the fifth consecutive monthly decline.
The cereal price index dropped 1.7%, with a decline in world prices of all major grains outweighing an increase in rice prices.
â€œThe increase in rice prices is extremely worrisome and it is essential that the Black Sea initiative is renewed to avoid any other spikes in wheat and maize,â€Â said FAO Chief Economist Maximo Torero.
The FAO report indicated that international wheat prices declined by 2.3% in April to their lowest level since July 2021, principally driven by large exportable availabilities in Russia and Australia.
According to the UN body, favorable crop conditions in Europe, along with an agreement at the end of April allowing Ukrainian grains to transit through European Union countries that had imposed import restrictions earlier in the month, also contributed to theÂ â€œoverall softer tone in markets.â€Â 
Meanwhile, Torero projected that as global economiesÂ â€œrecover from significant slowdowns, demand will increase, exerting upward pressure on food prices.â€

title: Buffett Turns Gloomy: The â€œIncredible Periodâ€ For The US Economy Is Coming To An End
text:
While Warren Buffettâ€™s insights on the economy are traditionally cheerful and uplifting â€“ usually hitting at time of peak pessimism in the form of self-servingÂ NYT op-edsÂ or CNBC vignettes (and usually around the time the Omaha billionaire knows that the government will backstop his TBTF investments, unlike those of pretty much anyone else), on Saturday the head of Berkshire Hathaway had a far more downbeat and gloomy prediction for his own businesses â€“ and the broader economy in general â€“ the good times may be over.
Speaking at Berkshireâ€™s annual general meeting in Omaha, Nebraska, the billionaire investor said he expectsÂ earnings at the majority of the conglomerateâ€™s operations to fall this yearÂ as the coming economic downturn slows corporate activity further. He made his pessimistic comments even as Berkshire posted an almost 13% gain in operating earnings to $8.07 billion for the first quarter, up from $7.04 billion a year ago.
â€œThe majority of our businesses will report lower earnings this year than last year,â€ Buffett, 92, said, before crowds of thousands at the event on SaturdayÂ according to Bloomberg. During the last six months or so, the â€œincredible periodâ€ for the US economy has been coming to an end, he said.

As Bloomberg notes Berkshire is often viewed as a proxy for economic health owing to the expansive nature of its businesses ranging from railroad to electric utilities and retail. Buffett himself has said Berkshire owes its success to the incredible growth of the US economy over the decades,Â but his prediction for a slowdown at his firms comes as upheaval at regional banks threatens to curtail lending as inflation and higher rates continue to bite.
Buffettâ€™s long-time business partner Charlie Munger, 99, who joined him on stage, said the more-difficult economic environment will also make it harder for value investors, who typically buy stocks that look cheap compared to the intrinsic value of the businesses.
â€œGet used to making less,â€ Munger said.
Despite the broader pessimism, Buffett said he expects earnings at its insurance underwriting operations â€” which are less correlated to business activity â€” to improve this year. Berkshire already reported higher earnings at those businesses including auto-insurer Geico, which swung to profitability following six quarters of losses.
Geico posted $703 million in earnings as higher average premiums and lower advertising spending contributed to the gain even as claim frequencies fell, Berkshire said in a statement reporting its earnings Saturday. That revival follows a difficult period for the underwriting business as inflation took its toll on the cost of materials and labor.
Geico has been facing particular pressure from rivals including Progressive, which Buffett has called â€œwell-run,â€ and Allstate which had long used telematics programs to track drivers and encourage better behavior before Geico introduced the offering. Geicoâ€™s profit also helped Berkshireâ€™s insurance underwriting businesses deliver $911 million in profit compared with $167 million a year earlier.
Berkshire previously said it expected Geico to return to operating profitability in 2023, after securing premium rate increases. Still, Geico remains an issue for Berkshire, with top line growth in the quarter of less than 1% that â€œsignificantly lags peers,â€ CFRA analyst Cathy Seifert said.
â€œI suspect rate hikes being put through to offset claim cost inflation is being met with policy cancellations,â€ she said. â€œWhile the loss of unprofitable policies is not always a bad thing- thatâ€™s not usually the policies â€” and policyholders â€” that leave.â€
Other parts of the conglomerate took a bigger hit,Â with after-tax earnings from Berkshire Hathaway Energy falling 46.3% from the same time last year amid â€œlower earnings from the US regulated utilities, other energy businesses and real estate brokerage businesses.â€ Railroad results were also weaker than expected due to a fall in freight volumes and higher operating expenses, according to Edward Jones analyst Jim Shanahan.
But at one of Berkshireâ€™s best known businesses, Brooks Running Co., Chief Executive Officer Jim Weber was skeptical of a steep consumer downturn.
â€œWith unemployment being so low, itâ€™s hard to be believing weâ€™re going to fall off a cliff into a recession at the consumer level,â€ Weber said in an interview on Friday ahead of the meeting. â€œI wonder if this is going to be an asset-value recession.â€
Among other topics discussed on Saturday were Buffettâ€™s succession, the banking crisis, the US debt ceiling crisis, the companyâ€™s investment in Occidental, Chnaâ€™s upcoming invasion of Taiwan and more:
Separately, Berkshire topped up its cash pile, ending the quarter with $130.6 billion, a $2 billion increase from the $128.6 billion at the end of the year. This means that Berkshire stands to make a bonanza from interest income as the Fed keeps hiking rates:Â â€œOur investment income is going to be a lot larger this year than last year, and thatâ€™s built in,â€ Buffett said at the annual meeting.
The company was also a net seller of equities for the second quarter in a row, pocketing $10.4 billion in net stock sales ($13.3 billion gross) after deducting purchases of $2.9 billion.
Finally, Berkshire bought back $4.4 billion of stock, an increase from the same period last year, as Bekrshire confronted turbulent markets that offered fewer of the blockbuster deals heâ€™s renowned for. Berkshire has turned toward buybacks more often as valuations in public markets had made it more challenging for Buffett to identify promising acquisitions.

title: Falling Trade Deficit Suggests a Weakening US Economy
text:
The March Trade Deficit decreased for the first time in four months. The total deficit came in at -$64.2B, which is the second smallest deficit since January 2021. This might seem like good news but itâ€™s yet another indication of a weakening economy.
Figure: 1 Monthly Plot Detail
The table below provides detail.
Monthly Trade Deficit
Looking at Trailing Twelve Month:
Figure: 2 Trade Balance Detail
Historical Perspective
Zooming out and focusing on the net numbers shows the longer-term trend. The latest month suggests the trend of a shrinking deficit is not yet over. The deficit numbers have returned to a much choppier month-over-month look which was pretty standard before Covid. If the US economy and USD continue to weaken, driving Imports down and Exports up, the Trade Deficit could return to pre-Covid levels soon.
Figure: 3 Historical Net Trade Balance
That said, the Services Surplus seems to have stabilized at a new level. After Net Services hovered around 35% of Exported Services for some time, it has now found a new range between 25% and 30% suggesting the Services Surplus has faced a relative contraction.
Figure: 4 Historical Services Surplus
To put it all together and remove some of the noise, the next plot below shows the Trailing Twelve Month (TTM) values for each month (i.e., each period represents the summation of the previous 12-months). The global surge in consumption post-Covid is clear to see below, or, more likely, the global increase in prices. The black line is showing a mild recovery on a TTM basis as noted above.
Figure: 5 Trailing 12 Months (TTM)
Although the TTM Net Trade Deficit is near historical highs, it can be put in perspective by comparing the value to US GDP. As the chart below shows, the current records are still below the 2006 highs before the Great Financial Crisis.
The current value of 3.28% is moving back down but is still well above the 2.5% from before Covid.
Figure: 6 TTM vs GDP
The chart below shows the YTD values. Total Exports have actually increased while total Imports have decreased when compared to the same period last year.
Figure: 7 Year to Date
Wrapping Up
The Trade Deficit is down from the records set last year, but the US is still printing very large Deficits relative to history. It is not totally surprising to see the current trend. There could be a few reasons for falling Imports and rising Exports. Itâ€™s safe to rule out increased domestic production and productivity. Itâ€™s more likely a combination of a falling dollar and rising inflation.
Rising inflation has taken a bite out of American incomes which leaves less money for goods. This has shown up as a decrease in Imported Goods. The falling US dollar has also made US goods more attractive to foreigners. This explains why Exports have increased.
This is a trend that could continue. As the US enters recession, the Fed gives up its inflation fight, and the world moves to de-dollarizeâ€¦ it will be harder for US consumers to continue running up massive trade deficits. If anything, all the dollars out there will likely come back to the US, making the inflation problem worse.
It is wise to diversify away from the dollar and maintain purchasing power. The best way to do this is to own precious metals.
Data Source:Â https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/BOPGSTB
Data Updated: Monthly on one month lag
Last Updated: May 04, 2023, for Mar 2023
US Debt interactive charts and graphs can always be found on theÂ Exploring FinanceÂ dashboard:Â https://exploringfinance.shinyapps.io/USDebt/

title: Watch: GOP Sen. John Kennedy Roasts Biden Energy Secretary On Climate Change
text:
Sen. John Kennedy (R-La.), a ranking member of the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee on Energy and Water Development,Â grilled Biden Energy Secretary David Turk during hearings this week.
Video clips of Kennedy questioning Turk are going viral online with Twitter users saying the GOP politician destroyed the administrationâ€™s global warming proposal.
Sen. John Kennedy Destroys Energy Secretary David Turkâ€™s Global Warming Proposal â€œYou donâ€™t know do you Mr. Secretary? You just want us to spend $50T and you donâ€™t have the slightest idea whether itâ€™s going to reduce world temperatures.â€pic.twitter.com/7MyWthrBx8
â€œGive me your best estimate, just an estimate, of how soon you think the United States of America will be carbon neutral?â€ the senator began his questioning.
Turk answered, â€œSo, I think, according to the climate scientists around the world, and certainly the cutting-edge scientists that we need to rely on here in the U.S., weâ€™ve got to get carbon neutral by 2050, and Iâ€™m very comfortable with that target, and I think thatâ€™s the appropriate target.â€
When Kennedy asked how much it would cost the nation to be carbon neutral by 2050, Turk couldnâ€™t answer despite the senator repeatedly trying to pry a cost amount from him.
At some point, the energy secretary admitted the cost would at least be in the trillions of dollars.

Turk again failed to provide an estimate regarding how much a carbon-neutral America would reduce temperatures around the world.
After Turk repeatedly danced around the answer, Kennedy cut him off, asking,Â â€œYou donâ€™t know do you?â€
The senator continued, â€œYou just want us to spend $50 trillion, and you donâ€™t have the slightest idea whether itâ€™s going to reduce world temperatures. Now Iâ€™m all for carbon neutrality, but youâ€™re the Deputy Secretary of the Department of Energy, and youâ€™re advocating we spend trillions of dollars to seek carbon neutrality and you canâ€™tâ€”and this isnâ€™t your money or my money, this is taxpayer moneyâ€”and you canâ€™t tell me how much itâ€™s going to lower world temperatures or you wonâ€™t tell me? You know, but you wonâ€™t.â€
In a separate video being shared on Twitter, Kennedy asked Solar Energy Industries Association President Abigail Hopper why the government has to pay people to drive electric cars if they are â€œso swell.â€
Hopper argued the government incentivizing citizens to buy electric vehicles isnâ€™t â€œpaying them to driveâ€ but Kennedy suggested the tax breaks they get do just that.
Sen. John Kennedy: "If electric cars are so swell, how come the government has to pay people to drive them?"@SenJohnKennedy pic.twitter.com/r6luiwDva0

title: Watch: Audience Cheers High School Student As She Confronts School Board on Trans Insanity
text:

title: Texas AG Ken Paxton Launches COVID-19 Vaccine Investigation into Big Pharma Gain of Function Research
text:
Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton announced heâ€™s launching an investigation into whether the major pharmaceutical companies engaged in gain of function research and misled the public about it.
Pfizer, Moderna, and Johnson & Johnson, the manufacturers of the experimental COVID mRNA vaccine, will be investigated for potential violations of the stateâ€™s Deceptive Trade Practices Act, the New York Post reported.
â€œThe catastrophic effects of the pandemic and subsequent interventions forced on our country and citizens deserve intense scrutiny, and we are pursuing any hint of wrongdoing to the fullest,â€ Paxton said in a statement.
â€œThis pandemic was a deeply challenging time for Americans,â€ he continued. â€œIf any company illegally took advantage of consumers during this period or compromised peopleâ€™s safety to increase their profits, they will be held responsible. If public health policy was developed on the basis of flawed or misleading research, the public must know.â€
â€œThis vested interestâ€¦combined with reports about the alarming side effects of vaccines, demands aggressive investigation,â€ he continued.
Paxton is demanding documents from the COVID shot producers related to â€œdecision-making behind pandemic interventions forced on the public, especially when a profit motive or political pressure may have compromised Americansâ€™ health and safety.â€
Paxtonâ€™s probe â€œcould have widespread implications for the legal immunity granted to manufacturers of the COVID-19 vaccines and open the door to class-action lawsuits from people injured by the mRNA jabs, amid reports of rare but serious adverse effects,â€ the New York Postâ€™s Miranda Devine wrote.
This comes after Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) called for a grand jury investigation into â€œcrimes and wrongdoing committed against Floridians related to the COVID-19 vaccine.â€Â 
â€œThe Biden administration and pharmaceutical corporations continue to push widespread distribution of mRNA vaccines on the public, including children as young as 6 months old, through relentless propaganda while ignoring real-life adverse events,â€ DeSantisâ€™ office said in a statement in December.Â 
â€œThese risks include coagulation disorders, acute cardiac injuries, Bellâ€™s palsy, encephalitis, appendicitis, and shingles.â€Â 
â€œWeâ€™ll be able to get the data whether they want to give it or not. In Florida, it is illegal to mislead and misrepresent, especially when you are talking about the efficacy of a drug,â€ he added.
A recent Pfizer report shows the company knew its COVID vaccine posed high rates dire fetal and infant health risks as early as 2021 but encouraged pregnant women, with the help of health institutions like the CDC and FDA, to take the COVID shot anyway.

title: Know Thy Enemy: Top 50 Players of the Censorship-Industrial Complex Revealed
text:
An in-depth report by journalist Matt Taibbi reveals the extent of a bureaucracy known as the Censorship Industrial Complex, a new system of control in the domain of â€œhybrid warfare.â€
Taibbi is one of the main publishers of the Twitter Files, which revealed how Twitter worked with a constellation of government, corporate, journalistic, and NGO entities to control narratives and information.
In a new report, Taibbi lists in great detail the Top 50 organizations that comprise the Censorship-Industrial Complex (CIC), which include intelligence agencies, top globalist institutions, corporations, far-left think tanks, and liberal â€œfact-checkers.â€
Specifically, the CIC is categorized into seven groups: Government entities, Foundations, Big Tech, For-Profit disinformation companies, Academic Initiatives, Think Tanks, â€œFact-Checkers,â€ and Non-Governmental Organizations.
Taibbi claimed the groundwork for the CIC was laid during the years-long Russia collusion hoax weaponized by the Deep State to destroy Donald Trump.
â€œThis is why the Trump-Russia scandal in the United States will likely be remembered as a crucial moment in 21st-century history, even though the investigation superficially ended a non-story, fake news in itself,â€ he wrote.
â€œWhat the Mueller investigation didnâ€™t accomplish in ousting Trump from office, it did accomplish in birthing a vast new public-private bureaucracy devoted to stopping â€˜mis-, dis-, and malinformation,â€™ while smoothing public acquiescence to the emergence of a spate of new government agencies with â€˜information warfareâ€™ missions.â€
He went on to say the social media â€œde-platformingâ€ of Infowars founder Alex Jones in 2018 was just the tip of the iceberg of the CIC system.
While the civilian population only in recent years began haggling over â€œde-platformingâ€ incidents involving figures like Alex Jones and Milo Yiannopoulos, government agencies had already long been advancing a new theory of international conflict, in which the informational landscape is more importantly understood as a battlefield than a forum for exchanging ideas. In this view, â€œspammyâ€ ads, â€œjunkâ€ news, and the sharing of work from â€œdisinformation agentsâ€ like Jones arenâ€™t inevitable features of a free Internet, but sorties in a new form of conflict called â€œhybrid warfare.â€Â 
Taibbi noted the CIC bills itself as a defense sector arm working for the good of the nation, but in reality itâ€™s a â€œmessaging systemâ€ meant to control the U.S. population.
The â€œCensorship-Industrial Complexâ€ is just the Military-Industrial Complex reborn for the â€œhybrid warfareâ€ age.
Much like the war industry, pleased to call itself the â€œdefenseâ€ sector, the â€œanti-disinformationâ€ complex markets itself as merely defensive, designed to fend off the hostile attacks of foreign cyber-adversaries who unlike us have â€œmilitary limitations.â€ The CIC, however, is neither wholly about defense, nor even mostly focused on foreign â€œdisinformation.â€ Itâ€™s become instead a relentless, unified messaging system aimed primarily at domestic populations, who are told that political discord at home aids the enemyâ€™s undeclared hybridÂ assault on democracy.Â 
He pointed out that these censorship and information control groups are fundamentally destroying democracy using â€œhybrid warfareâ€ techniques to control the flow of information.
Together, these groups are fast achieving what Eisenhower feared: the elimination of â€œbalanceâ€ between the democratic need for liberalizing laws and institutions, and the vigilance required for military preparation. Democratic society requires the nourishment of free debate, disagreement, and intellectual tension, but the groups below seek instead that â€œshared vocabularyâ€ to deploy on the hybrid battlefield. They propose to serve as the guardians of that â€œvocabulary,â€ which sounds very like the scenario Ike outlined in 1961, in which â€œpublic policy could itself become the captive of a scientific and technological elite.â€
Taibbi said his list tries to answer â€œa few basic questions about funding, organization type, history, and especially, methodologyâ€ for â€œreporters and researchers beginning their journey toward learning the scale and ambitionâ€ of the CIC.

title: Proud Boys Members Found Guilty of Seditious Conspiracy, Face Decades in Prison
text:
Four leaders of the pro-Trump group Proud Boys were convicted of seditious conspiracy in the Jan. 6 trial, according to verdicts announced on Thursday.
The Proud Boys founder and leader, Enrique Tarrio, as well as members Joe Biggs, Ethan Nordean, and Zachary Rehl, all face a maximum of 20 years in prison for the charge of seditious conspiracy.
Hereâ€™s the definition of â€œseditious conspiracyâ€ from 18 U.S. Code Â§ 2384:
If two or more persons in any State or Territory, or in any place subject to the jurisdiction of the United States, conspire to overthrow, put down, or to destroy by force the Government of the United States, or to levy war against them, or to oppose by force the authority thereof, or by force to prevent, hinder, or delay the execution of any law of the United States, or by force to seize, take, or possess any property of the United States contrary to the authority thereof, they shall each be fined under this title or imprisoned not more than twenty years, or both.

title: Texas AG Ken Paxton Launches COVID-19 Vaccine Investigation into Big Pharma Gain of Function Research
text:
Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton announced heâ€™s launching an investigation into whether the major pharmaceutical companies engaged in gain of function research and misled the public about it.
Pfizer, Moderna, and Johnson & Johnson, the manufacturers of the experimental COVID mRNA vaccine, will be investigated for potential violations of the stateâ€™s Deceptive Trade Practices Act, the New York Post reported.

â€œThis pandemic was a deeply challenging time for Americans,â€ he continued. â€œIf any company illegally took advantage of consumers during this period or compromised peopleâ€™s safety to increase their profits, they will be held responsible. If public health policy was developed on the basis of flawed or misleading research, the public must know.â€
â€œThis vested interestâ€¦combined with reports about the alarming side effects of vaccines, demands aggressive investigation,â€ he continued.
Paxton is demanding documents from the COVID shot producers related to â€œdecision-making behind pandemic interventions forced on the public, especially when a profit motive or political pressure may have compromised Americansâ€™ health and safety.â€
Paxtonâ€™s probe â€œcould have widespread implications for the legal immunity granted to manufacturers of the COVID-19 vaccines and open the door to class-action lawsuits from people injured by the mRNA jabs, amid reports of rare but serious adverse effects,â€ the New York Postâ€™s Miranda Devine wrote.
This comes after Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) called for a grand jury investigation into â€œcrimes and wrongdoing committed against Floridians related to the COVID-19 vaccine.â€Â 
â€œThe Biden administration and pharmaceutical corporations continue to push widespread distribution of mRNA vaccines on the public, including children as young as 6 months old, through relentless propaganda while ignoring real-life adverse events,â€ DeSantisâ€™ office said in a statement in December.Â 
â€œThese risks include coagulation disorders, acute cardiac injuries, Bellâ€™s palsy, encephalitis, appendicitis, and shingles.â€Â 
â€œWeâ€™ll be able to get the data whether they want to give it or not. In Florida, it is illegal to mislead and misrepresent, especially when you are talking about the efficacy of a drug,â€ he added.
A recent Pfizer report shows the company knew its COVID vaccine posed high rates dire fetal and infant health risks as early as 2021 but encouraged pregnant women, with the help of health institutions like the CDC and FDA, to take the COVID shot anyway.

As of January 1, 2018, if you are caught speeding, the amount of your fine will depend on the model of your vehicle, lawmakers say. The change will be used to help pay for more police, and more road repairs in nearly every state in the country.
â€œThe more expensive the vehicle, the more expensive the fine will be,â€ said George Marks, R-Georgia, who sponsored the bill, which was passed by the House on September 21st. â€œIf you can afford a $90,000 Tesla sports car, then your ticket is going to be a lot higher than the tool driving the beat up Mazda.â€
ForÂ photographs taken by radar, an auto expert will determine the model of the car, motorcycle, or truck. The cheapest vehicles will be fined lightly, whereas high-end vehicles will face much heavier fines.
This measure acknowledges the inequality between those â€œwho can affordâ€ to pay the fines and those who â€œsufferâ€ under the repressive system. Thus, the wallets of the most well-to-do will be hit just as hard as those of the most humble.
The measure promises to reduce delinquency on the road by the wealthy, thus eliminating the feeling of impunity shared among more and more drivers.

â€œI want to be friends with them, not enemies. And it makes me sad that they stop me being friends with other autonomous nations.â€
The Dalai Lama has been refused entry into South Africa on numerous occasions, as they do not want to compromise relations with China.
â€œI wanted to visit my old friend, [Archbishop] Desmond Tutu. But they wouldnâ€™t let me go to his birthday bash. Has anyone ever stopped a toddler from attending birthday parties because of international relations concerns? No. Hereâ€™s to being a baby.â€

title: Man at Party Actually Thinks His Story About Bad Restaurant Service is Interesting
text:
Local man Ed Vermeulen, 37, actually thinks the story he is telling about the bad service he got at a restaurant today is interesting. The bore is, in his deluded opinion, regaling friends at the same dinner party with information on how rude the waitress at Don Pedroâ€™s was, that he was given goats cheese in his chicken salad instead of regular feta, and that their prices were disproportional to their customer care.
â€œHeâ€™s telling us about how he almost didnâ€™t give a tip,â€ friend Roger Walter mumbled. â€œAt least if he had carried through on that, thereâ€™d be something interesting about this anecdote.â€
Vermeulen is oblivious to the fact that his hosts are looking nervously at their watches, trying to lead their faltering party in a different direction. He doesnâ€™t even realize that theyâ€™ve already interrupted three times, in an attempt to move on to the next course and a new topic of conversation.
â€œFor the amount of money they get paid â€“ and yes, they get paid minimum wage which is more than they deserve â€“ they really should put more effort into their work,â€ he is saying, drawing an attempt at an argument from one liberal friend, who is shushed by friends who will do anything not to let this story carry on any longer than it needs to. â€œI mean, Don Pedroâ€™s is a respectable establishment, with a reputation to keep up.â€
Acquaintances are nodding their heads, in the hope that heâ€™ll stop talking if they donâ€™t actively participate, but Vermeulen is continuing, saying, â€œItâ€™s not the only place thatâ€™s in my bad books,â€ bringing audible groans around the table.

title: American Airlines Annoyed That the Media Loves Plane Crashes
text:
American Airlines has expressed its annoyance with the mediaâ€™s obsession with plane crashes. It seems like all you see on CNN is plane crashes. Itâ€™s just not fair.â€
Media analyst, John Tremp, agreed with the sentiment.
â€œThe ratios are pretty insane,â€ said Tremp. â€œThe number of planes that crash in a year â€“ less than 200. The amount of airtime it gets on all media platforms â€“ fucking enormous. Itâ€™s like the porn industry â€“ there are exponentially more pornos portraying a housewife getting fucked by the pool boy than what happens in real life. Itâ€™s no wonder American Airlines is pissed.â€
But the media has collectively promised not to stop the immense over coverage of such events saying, â€œAmerica perves over this stuff. Traffic on RedTube and YouPorn goes down â€“ pardon the pun â€“ during coverage of air disasters. We as the media are committed to giving the citizens of the USA what they want, even if it is somewhat sickening.â€
According to statistics, even articles blasting the obsession bring in unnecessary details of the event. For example, such articles will tell you that the co-pilot had been treated for suicidal thoughts, which surely is not something everyone has to know. Also routinely reported is inside info of the captainâ€™s final words, including the devastating cry of â€œFor Godâ€™s sake open the door!â€ â€“ pure voyeurism.

title: Colorado Teens Injecting Marijuana To Get High
text:

title: Netanyahu Secures Election Victory, Ready To Resume Guessing What U.S. Wants
text:
Benjamin Netanyahu has been strongly criticised regarding statements he made immediately prior to the Israeli elections last week. He expressed definitively that the touted Two State Solution would not occur â€œon [his] watchâ€. Additionally, he warned right-wingers that Arabs were â€œcoming out in drovesâ€ to vote, and that they must counter that; a statement that had not so subtle racist undertones.
But Netanyahu characteristically responded powerfully this week, in an apparent return to the status quo of saying just enough to appease the US government and keep up relations between the two nations. He swiftly denied he had abandoned the Two State Solution, despite recorded evidence of him having done so. He also apologized for being racist, saying â€œsome of my best subjects are Arabsâ€.
Political analysts responded with an atypical disinterest to the Israeli Prime Ministerâ€™s remarks. According to them, the whole process was â€œtediously predictableâ€.
â€œEveryone knew heâ€™d pander to right-winger in order to win essential votes to keep him in power,â€ said NBCâ€™s Hunter Worthington. â€œOf course, he could not stand by those comments without drastically damaging Israeli-US relations, which letâ€™s be honest â€“ Israel needs us more than we need them.â€
John Oliver, presenter of weekly HBO satire Last Week Tonight, was far more ebullient in his coverage of Netanyahuâ€™s obvious political manoeuvring.
â€œIf he gets away with this, he should be known as NetanyaHou-dini,â€ the British anchor said. Oliver is known to pull no punches, even when it comes to important US officials and allies, and more is expected from him on this front.
â€œI think we can expect John [Oliver] to mock Netanyahuâ€™s future comments that he treasures his relationship with President Obama; his commitment to the safety of the Arab population in the Occupied Territories; as well as his assertions that he actually plans to work towards a peace that involves Palestinian statehood while opposing it in the UN.â€

title: Abortion Clinic Busted For Selling Fetuses To Chinese Restaurant
text:
Police first became aware of the BeijingÂ restaurant using human fetuses as part of their cuisine when several people were hospitalized after eating at the restaurant. Representatives from the Sellersburg Department of Health were called by doctors at Clark Memorial Hospital to investigate the conditions at Beijing,Â assuming improper food storage or preparations. The Department of Health was shocked at what they found.
â€œThey had an entire walk-in refrigerator dedicated to unborn fetuses, all of them in different stages of dismemberment. It was clear they were using them as part of their recipes.â€ Said Brendan Kelly, department head for the Sellersburg D.O.H. â€œWe immediately closed the restaurant, and contacted state officials.â€
â€œWe were contacted by the Department of Health, who informed us that a local abortion clinic may beÂ selling discarded fetuses to the BeijingÂ restaurant.â€ Said Captain Joseph GoldsmithÂ of the Indiana State Police. â€œWe moved in quickly on both establishments, making sure that we got a lock on all this as soon as possible.â€
Along with the owners of the BeijingÂ Restaurant, Soi Cha and Fo Shi, officials also arrested two men from the Sunbright Family Planning Clinic. Alex Coates and Ryan Wintson will be facing charges for their part in the theft and sale of the fetuses, which officials believe had been happening for years.
â€œAlexÂ and RyanÂ were two members of our nighttime cleaning crew whoâ€™d worked for us for almost 6 years.â€ Said Doctor Thomas Telford of the Sunbright Clinic. â€œI am shocked that they could or would do something like this. Sickened and appalled.â€
All four men will be facing charges in Sellersburg Superior Court. Cha and Shi, the purchasers of the unborn fetuses, are charged with assault and attempted manslaughter, because of the illnesses they caused in customers, as well as with the lesser charge of dismembering a corpse, which is a misdemeanor in the state of Indiana. Coates and Winston are being charged with theft and sale of human remains, theft of medical supplies and equipment, theft of medical waste, assault, and attempted manslaughter. Each are facingÂ up to a 9Â year sentence if convicted.
â€œThis is without a doubt the most disturbing thing thatâ€™s happened in thisÂ town.â€ Said Kelly. â€œWe never expected to come across something so dark and grotesque.â€
Both BeijingÂ and the Sunbright Clinic have been closed for investigation until further notice.Â Doctors at Sunbright Clinic say they were completely unaware that this was happening in their offices, and at the time of this writing, no charges were being filed against anyÂ of their medical staff.

title: Death Row Inmate Survives Execution; Released From Prison
text:
The prison warden, Joseph Goldsmith, called Farmingtonâ€™sÂ survival â€œa divine intervention.â€
â€œWe have two methods of execution in the state of Tennessee.â€ said Goldsmith. â€œIt is has always been our tradition to let the inmate choose how they want to go. Mr. Farmington is the first person to try their hand at both options. We are taking it as a sign from God that this man is just not meant to die.â€
Farmington had his first execution scheduledÂ in late 2013 via lethal injection. At that time, his body did not react to the sodium thiopental, which is the first in a series of three drugs given to someone being executed. Sodium thiopental is designed to render a person unconscious before they inject bromide, which causes paralysis, and finally potassium chloride, which induces cardiac arrest.
Dr. Robert Liston was the medical examiner on staff for the state prison during Farmingtonâ€™s first execution.
â€œI have never seen anything like it in all my years as a medical doctor.â€ Said Liston. â€œSodium thiopental is not something someone can generally be â€˜immuneâ€™ to, but Farmingtonâ€™s body did not react. The drug should have hit him within 30 seconds. We waited over ten minutes, then dosed him again. Nothing.â€
Doctors and prison staff had no choice but to postpone the execution, and the governor granted temporary reprieve for Farmington, giving him another six months on death row, while he awaited his second execution date.
Last week, the prison again tried to execute Farmington, this time via electric chair.
â€œFarmington chose to not go through lethal injection a second time, and opted for electrocution.â€ Said Goldsmith. â€œWe hadnâ€™t fired up olâ€™ sparky since 2007, but it was his choice and we honored it.â€
Prison officials were stunned when, for a second time, Farmington was spared death, this time when the electric chair failed to operate.
â€œWe threw those switches, and on the third flip, youâ€™re supposed to see sparks fly, but we saw nothing.â€ Said Goldsmith. â€œWe got Farmington out of the chair, hooked everything back up, fired it up, and it worked like a charm. We didnâ€™t even try putting him back in again.â€
Per federal law, Farmington was immediately releasedÂ from prison, as any inmate who survives his execution twice is automatically allowed a full pardon.
â€œWe wish Farmington all the best in his new life outside prison walls.â€ Said Governor Bill Haslam as he signed Farmingtonâ€™s release forms. â€œThis man may be a bloodthirsty, violent individual, but some higher power has given him a second chance at life. We certainly hope he uses it for something better this time around.â€
Attorneys for Farmington could not be reached for comment.

title: New Jeresey Teenager Hospitalized With Facebook Withdrawals
text:
â€œI was terrified, we both were.â€ Said Marge Thompson, Nancyâ€™s mother. â€œI heard noises and murmuringÂ upstairs. I went to Nancyâ€™s room, and she was rocking back-and-forth on her bead, mumbling â€œLike. Like. Comment. Like. Share,â€ and her thumbs were twitching in a texting motion involuntarily. We called 9-1-1 immediately.â€
Ambulances were at the Thompson house in minutes, with paramedics prepared for the worst.
â€œWe arrived, and Nancy was still trembling. Itâ€™s a scene Iâ€™ve bared witness to many times lately. The â€˜Social-Media Shakesâ€™, thatâ€™s whatÂ we call them.â€ Said Glen Lantz, one of the paramedics on the scene. â€œWe were loading her into the ambulance, and that was when I saw the look she had. NancyÂ had a prettyÂ standard resting bitch face, but then I sawÂ her lips starting to curl back and one arm started to rise above her head. I recognized the selfie-signs instantly, and immediately sedated her before any of us had to seeÂ her morph into duck face mode.â€
Parents today are more and more often using social media restrictions asÂ punishments for their children and teenagers. As evident in Nancyâ€™s case, it is not always the best solution. Rod Lane, a professional child psychiatrist, says that teens and young adults need their social networks more than ever, and taking them away can have serious adverse effects, much the same as with drug and alcohol addiction.
â€œI know that when your teen does something wrong, telling them they canâ€™t get on Facebook is the quickest thing to come to your head. I implore all parents, please donâ€™t do this.â€ Said Lane. â€œYour child needs to be weened off their social media, like a heroin abuserÂ who goes to a methadone clinic. Just like with â€œtrueâ€ drugs, your child can become violent and hostile, or conversely, they can become completely withdrawn and depressed, all because social media is removed from their lives too quickly.â€
Nancyâ€™s father, Donald Thompson, says that the first thing he did when Nancy awoke in the hospital was give her back herÂ 32GB gold iPhone 5 so she could get online.
â€œI never want to have to go through something like this again. I swear I will never take away her Facebook privileges as long as I live. My baby girl can take all the half-nude, fake tanned, stupid-ass duck face pictures she wants. Iâ€™ll even â€˜likeâ€™ them all myself!â€
Nancy responded by saying it would be a â€œcold day in hellâ€ before she added her dad on Facebook. She also updated her status on Facebook to â€œPrnts are soooo f-ing lame. hospitul food sucks. some1 bring me an f-ing Pinkberry like NOW!â€ It immediately received â€˜Likesâ€™ from 143 ofÂ Nancyâ€™s 2,486 friends.

title: School Suspends Student For Gun Shaped Birthmark
text:
â€œYou cannot be too careful in this day and age. We donâ€™t want to promote guns or gun violence in our schools. What if another kid in the class saw that? He might have gotten excited and wanted a gun birthmark, too.â€ Said Brooks, an English teacher at Milford Jr. High. â€œI donâ€™t think itâ€™s appropriate in our school.â€
Recently throughout the country there has been an excessive amount of â€œgun paranoiaâ€ in schools, with children being suspended or even expelled for things as menial as biting a Pop-Tart into the shape of a gun or even just pointing a finger at someone else and saying â€œboom,â€ which is what happened only a few short months ago in Ohion to 10Â year-old Nathan Entingh.

It was 94 degrees here yesterday. Is he supposed to wear pants every day until the end of the school year? Or maybe they want me to chop his leg clean off?â€
According to school superintendent Donna Winter, that is exactly what the school expects.
â€œWhen [name deleted] returns to school in 4 days, we will still have just about a week left of school. We are expecting that he will continue to wear long pants throughout the school year, and indeed, for the remainder of his schooling here in the Milford School District. Of course, he is always allowed to take the extreme decision of removing his leg entirely. Itâ€™s possible that would be best not only for his return to school, but also for his future. Weâ€™re talking about guns, here.â€
The parents have contacted a lawyer with the American Civil Liberties Union to argue that it is outside of the schoolâ€™s rights to force only their son to wear long pants. â€œEither everyone has to wear pants, or my son doesnâ€™t either. We canâ€™t make everyone else have gun shaped birthmarks, so they canâ€™t make him wear pants.â€
The family is debating on homeschooling their son for the remainder of his education to avoid any further conflict. It is unclear, at this time, whether or not there will be any police involvement with the student for his â€œcarrying a concealed birthmark.â€

title: Democrats Invite Iranian President To Speak Before Congress â€˜Just To Piss Off Republicansâ€™
text:
In the latest round of exchanged animosities between the Republican and Democratic Parties, Barack Obama has officially invited Iranian president, Hassan Rouhani, to speak before Congress. The news comes in the wake of House Speaker, John Boehner, inviting Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu to speak in what is usually considered a â€˜sacredâ€™, constitutionally defended forum.

Also, we happen to know that the Republicans will hate this. Two can play at this game.â€
Political experts around the country have been frantically throwing their opinions at our reporters.

Congress has already been likened this week to a â€˜high schoolâ€™, a â€˜neighborhood watch meetingâ€™, and a â€˜parents-teachers AGMâ€™. The Republican invitation to Netanyahu â€“ which was kept secret until all plans were finalised â€“ was an unprecedented breach of protocol. All the more so, since Netanyahuâ€™s agenda was apparent â€“ as the speech coincided with the upcoming Israeli elections.

title: Man Drives Car Through Donut Shop After Learning They Are Out of Maple Glazed
text:

We asked himÂ to leave and he wouldnâ€™t, butÂ when I went to call the police, thatâ€™s when he ran out of the store.â€

title: Man Electrocuted, Dies While Smoking E-Cigarette
text:
â€œMichael started smoking really young. It was my fault. I smoked around him all the time, and left cigarettes laying around,â€ Said Charmaine Del, Michaelâ€™s mother. â€œHe had decided he wanted to quit. We both did, and we heard the e-cigs were a good way to help. So I bought us both one to get started. Heâ€™d only been using it for about a week.â€
Reports from the hospital were that Del had been using his e-cigarette while it was plugged into his truck, charging. E-cigarettets are small, pen-sized items that contain internal batteries, and smokers can add nicotine-infused flavor â€˜cartridgesâ€™ into them. Just like a cell phone, the batteries can be charged, and most e-cigarettes come with USB charger similar to that of a phone.
The instructions for most e-cigarettes that have chargers insist that you do not try to use them while charging, but like most men Del apparently skipped the directions and opted to just try and figure out how they worked using trial-and-error. Unfortunately for him, the warnings posted on the package for this product were extremely important.
A representative for Black, INC., the manufacturer of the e-cigarette Del had purchased, released a statement expressing their condolences.
â€œWe at Black are extremely saddenedÂ to learn that one of our products has caused the death of a customer. We are terribly sorry, as these unfortunate events are never easy for anyone. We send or deepest sympathies to his family. As this is the first such death from e-cigarettes though, weâ€™d like to remind people that weâ€™re still doing far better than Big Tobacco, whose death toll is in the millions.â€
E-cigarettes have been a continued source of controversy since they first launched only a few short years ago, and the debate about their safety in comparison to a traditional cigarette has caused a stir in the medical community. This is the first death caused by e-cigarettes since their widespread use began in 2003.

title: Obama Signs Bill Forgiving All Student Loan Debt
text:
â€œAny student, past or present, who has taken loans from the federal government within the last 10 years to pay for higher education, will no longer be required to pay back those loans.â€ Said President Obama. â€œThis forgiveness also is to be extended toÂ any student currently enrolled in college, who may need financial assistance for the next several years as they finish their degrees.â€
The idea of student loan forgiveness has been in the news for several years now, as students are forced year-after-year to leave school due to crippling costs of a higher education in the US. With most students not able to afford any facet of college without loans, the government has given out nearly $1 trillion dollars to those seeking a form of higher education. Although certain costs of school are generally offset by private loans, grants, and scholarships, almost every student currently in a 2 or 4-year program has some existing loans with the US government.
â€œEducation is the single most important thing in my mind when it comes to furthering this great nation.â€ Said Obama. â€œI can think of no better way to help the young people, this next generation of thinkers and doers, than by helping them to stand on their feet more firmly, and to give them some hope that they can and will receive their degrees, and they can work towards a future for themselves and their families, and not just a future of paying back debt.â€
Although the bill wasÂ signed on ThursdayÂ afternoon in a live press conference, the forgiveness of loans will not begin until the end of 2016 at which point current and former students will begin to see interest and repayment amounts dwindle automatically, eventually leaving everyone with a complete zero-dollar balance.
Even while the government has decided to forgive loans from the public sector, private held companies such as Sallie Mae, the leading lender for higher education, still has sky-high interest rates and non-budging repayment schedules. With close to $1 billion in net income every year, Â Sallie Mae has stated that they are not interested in following suit with the governments plan for loan forgiveness.
â€œWe are a private company, and private lenders. We have no interest in not pursuing every possible avenue to squeeze everyÂ penny we can out of our borrowers.â€ Said Carla Edwarton, CEO of Sallie Mae. â€œEducation is important to us, but paying back your loans are what we care about. We arenâ€™t loan sharks, we arenâ€™t going to break your kneecaps if you donâ€™t pay, as much as we would like toâ€¦[But] you can bet we love making all that sweet, sweet high-interest rate cash.â€
Students who are currently making payments or have defaulted on their loansÂ can expect to receive a packet letter within the next 3 to 4 monthsÂ detailing how their assistance loans will be forgiven and what percentage, if any, will be left owed to private companies and firms.

title: Barack Obama In Blue Suit May Actually Be White President in Gold Suit
text:
WASHINGTON, D.C. â€“
A fearsome debate has broken out on social media across the globe over whether Barack Obama is a black president dressed in blue, or a white president dressed in gold. Obama has long been considered the first black president of America, but is he really?
The controversy was sparked by a photo of the president at a gala event in California last weekend. Although more than fifty percent of viewers saw the African American leader in a blue suit, a significant minority insist that he is a white man in a gold suit. YouTube videos attempting to explain the phenomena have gone viral, but which reality is real?
â€œThis is a fantastic example of how peopleâ€™s brains do not interpret sensory input in a uniform way,â€ said physicist Michael Surewood. â€œThere are many possible explanations for why different individuals see different colors, including the possibility of our minds assuming that the president was standing in shade, that shadows were falling across his outfit, and so on. But what is clear, is that the very identity of our countryâ€™s leader is in doubt.â€
Republican MPs have come out strongly in support of the white and gold rendering of the president, some going so far as to say that the â€œfirst African American President line was a simple deception to draw in liberal votes.â€ Rand Paul, a possible contender for the 2016 presidential elections, is at the forefront of this view.
â€œYou canâ€™t tell me what Iâ€™m seeing is wrong,â€ he said to reporters. â€œI see a white president in a gold suit, and thatâ€™s that. Am I meant to believe that my eyes donâ€™t work properly? Iâ€™ve been categorizing people by colors all my life. I think I would know when I see a white man.â€
However, photographs have emerged of the prototype of Barack Obama, showing conclusively a black president in a blue suit. Debate may continue over why Obama looks white to some Americans, but what is sure is that he really is a black man.

title: Iranâ€™s Supreme Leader Not a Fan of â€˜American Sniperâ€™
text:
Iranâ€™s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has spoken out against critically acclaimed film, American Sniper, saying that he is â€œnot a fan.â€ The screenplay, which portrays a real-life US soldier who killed 160 â€˜enemiesâ€™, struck a nerve with the spiritual head of the Islamic country.

Some have criticized the film for portraying Islamic people as â€˜uncivilisedâ€™ and the conflict as â€˜simplisticâ€™, but the supreme leaderâ€™s criticisms have gone far beyond what he calls â€œpossible thematic inaccuraciesâ€, sparking a feud with director and producer, Clint Eastwood. â€œWhat bothers me most is the way the camera angles make the action look contrived, bastardized to resemble any other Hollywood action movie,â€ he added.
Eastwood, who reminded us that he is the man responsible forÂ the highest-grossing war film in history, hit back at Khameneiâ€™s comments, saying, â€œWho is he to judge? Iâ€™ve seen his work. [1991 Iranian drama] Mother totally sucked â€“ yes, it wasnâ€™t Hollywood-ised, and it was gritty and moving, but it hardly had a budget, and some of the actors were clearly amateur and didnâ€™t even speak English!â€
After half an hour of Googling the Ayatollahâ€™s filmography, we managed to track down the movie in question, and found it to be attributed to Iranian director Ali Hatami, and not Khamenei, to whom Eastwood inaccurately credited it.
Iranian President, Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, publicly disagreed with the supreme leader, simply saying, â€œEastwood is legendary. Donâ€™t f*** with him.â€

title: Man Survives Suicide Attempt After Jumping From 20 Story Building
text:

title: U.S. Flooding Vodka Into Russia to Slow Military Aggressions

title: Luckiest Man Alive Survives Asia Airlines Crash; Later Killed by Airline Peanuts
text:
TAIPEI, Taiwan â€“ 
Leo Yang was among the first survivors to appear alive from the wreckage following the TransAsia crash in Taiwan 2 days ago. The 34-year-old businessman appeared, miraculously unscathed, following the incident, which made his death less than an hour later all the more tragic.
Yang had been pulled from the wreckage with little more than a scratch on him, baffling the rescuers who helped save him. He was reported as appearing respectively calm and collected during the extraction.
â€œWhen he came out, he thanked us politely and sat in our rescue raft until we took him back to shore,â€ one rescue worker said. â€œWe assumed he was in a state of shock or something like that. He was almost too calm. After we brought him to shore, he leaned against a rail and pulled out a package of airline peanuts. That was the last time we saw him alive.â€
According to an eyewitness, Yang had propped himself against a railing along a walkway. There he stood and attempted to open a package of peanuts for a good hour while he watched the rescue crew continue to work.
â€œThat bag must have been hard to open. But he was calm the whole time,â€ said the onlooker. â€œNews crews kept passing him by. They thought he was an onlooker because he was so calm.â€
The witness then said that Yang suddenly reacted violently. â€œAs soon as he was able to open the peanuts and began eating them, he clutched his throat and began to convulse. It wasnâ€™t long before he collapsed. I called over the paramedics that were available, but it was too late.â€
According to paramedics on the scene, Yang fell to an acute allergic reaction to whey protein.
â€œSome of these packaging companies use a whey powder to help preserve the flavor of peanuts in packaging. Yang apparently did not read the nutrition label on the package, likely due to being emotionally flustered. The adrenaline associated with shock from the crash likely had his body redlining, and so the reaction to the allergy was swift and intense.â€
Yang is survived by his wife Patty and his three sons, Charlie, Franklin, and Linus.

title: NASAâ€™s Hubble Telescope Discovers Signs of Life In Extremely Distant Galaxy
text:
NASA spokesperson Carl Wright said that the new findings are a major breakthrough for not only NASA, but for the entire world. â€œWhat we have found, with the proof we have discovered, this is possibly the biggest, most important finding in NASA history,â€ Wright told the Associated Press. â€œThis absolutely puts to rest any doubt that life exists outside of our own galaxy.â€
Peering through the giant cosmic magnifying glass, the Hubble Space Telescope spotted the galaxy last month. It is said to be the furthest galaxy ever seen, at more than 65 billion light years away. The galaxy, known as X12-P45, was detected by the Frontier Fields program, an ambitious three-year study that teams Hubble with NASAâ€™s other observatories, the Spitzer Space Telescope and the powerful Chandra X-ray Observatory. These powerful lenses allow astronomers to find distant, dim structures that until now have been too faint to see.
Wright went on to explain in the briefing that the forms of life discovered seem to be those of intelligence. â€œWe arenâ€™t just talking about a few plants or trees of some kind, we are talking about intelligent life forms which have built structures, civilizations, buildings. These structures were built by something, which only leads us to believe they are aliens of some kind, maybe even very human-like beings. It remains to be seen, but this is huge progress for the entire world to find something of such important significance,â€ Wright stated.
When asked if NASA expects the findings of alleged intelligent life form to panic people on the planet Earth, Wright chuckled, and assured that there is no impending source of danger. â€œWe clearly are the aggressors here, the people of the world have nothing to fear. We canâ€™t do anything without being violent and forceful, so if we know they are there before they know we are here, then all is well. The further ahead we get in science, the bigger the advantage we have. If these turn out to be hostile alien life forms, we will take the bull by the horns. Never under-estimate the power of mankind.â€ he said.

title: Pope Francis Praises Attack Of Charlie Hebdo, Demands Retraction After Media Reports He â€˜Condemnedâ€™ Act

title: World Famous Rockefeller Christmas Tree In NYC Turns Out To Be Artificial
text:

I think it looks fine, and letâ€™s face it â€“ who likes sweeping up all those needles? I sure wouldnâ€™t. Itâ€™s still beautiful.â€

Rockefeller Center spokesperson Marcia Bibb said there is no ill will held toward the Connor family, but said in the future an alternate tree would be considered. â€œAllâ€™s well that ends well,â€ said Bibb. â€œThe environmentalists are happy, the Connors are happy, and the visitors seem to be enjoying the season as they do every year. Happy holidays!â€

â€œI have pardoned myself for my crimes, and for lying to the country,â€ said the President. â€œTherefore, I will not be able to be arrested or taken into custody. In the eyes of our great judicial system, I have now done nothing wrong.â€

â€œI am so glad that you asked that,â€ said Obama. â€œTo be truthful â€“ no, I am not from this great nation. Nor was I born in Kenya. To be fair, I am actually not even of this world. I come from a distant planet, known as Garlarktaschpel,Â which when translated to English becomes â€˜Change.â€™ I am, indeed, the most illegal kind of alien there is.â€
â€œI have tried to tell you all from the beginning that â€˜Changeâ€™ was coming, and I am making this announcement now to let you know that â€˜Changeâ€™ is very near. My people, the Changers, are nearing Earth. We are coming. The Changers will bring life to those who deserve it, and death to the remaining. It will be The Rapture. It will be the end for most. If you thought you feared â€˜Changeâ€™ before, then just wait for whatâ€™s coming.â€

title: Congress Proposes Ban On Out-of-Country Destination Weddings
text:
â€œThe growing conflict in the Middle East, and our own economic crisis closer to home mean that we all have to make sacrifices,â€ said Speaker of the House John Boehner, appearing paler than usual.Â  â€œMy golf vacation was cut short, so I spent less time in the sun,â€ he said.Â  â€œThat was my sacrifice.Â  The President still has not managed to pull us out of the deepest recession weâ€™ve ever faced, no matter how many bills he sends down to us that we refuse to act upon.â€
One proposed economy-saving measure causing a great deal of uproar is H.R. 7643, The Defense of Domestic Marriage Destination Act, introduced the day after Labor Day.Â  The bill prohibits destination weddings that take place outside the borders of the United States and its territories in an effort to keep revenue from enriching other countries.
â€œWeâ€™re losing billions of dollars each year because self-centered newlyweds, mostly liberals, refuse to keep American money inside America,â€ said Rep. Steve King, Republican from Iowaâ€™s 4th District. Â Airplanes, hotels, foodÂ â€“ all of this capital is being outsourced to foreign countries, and these are just â€˜tip-of-the-icebergâ€™ issues,â€ he added.Â  â€œThatâ€™s why I came back early from my vacation trip to Spain.â€
In 2013, the U.S. wedding industry generated $51 billion in revenue, according to the financial journal Revenue Tracker.
According to Brides Magazine, wedding photographers, lawn chair manufacturers, spray tan technicians, gown designers, shoe dyers, and ring bearer/flower girl trainers are just some of the 800,000 professionals employed by the domestic wedding industry each year.
Bridesâ€™ executive editor Connie Nast says, â€œThis is not the right way to go about fixing the economy.Â  If I were a bride today, forced with the prospect of keeping my marriage domestic,â€ says Nast, â€œI would be absolutely livid with rage.Â  The government has no right to put restrictions on where and when married couples should have the most stressful and happiest day of their lives.Â  I was married in London, and it was magnificent.â€
New York City bride-to-be Tara Faulkner had this to say, while at her final fitting at Brooklynâ€™s famous Kleinfeld Bridal. Â â€œNobody, not nobody, and that includes the President, or even the executive director of Congress or whatever she calls herself â€“ Pelosi, Mary Pelosi I think is her name â€“ well, sheâ€™s not going to tell me what to do.Â  Iâ€™m a U.S. citizen of America and if I choose to take my money out of my country, then thatâ€™s nobodyâ€™s damn business but my own!â€
â€œItâ€™s going to be a rough ride,â€ said Boehner, as he conferred with aides on plans and strategies for the upcoming last session of the 113th Congress.
Boehner will be meeting with members ofÂ Washingtonâ€™s powerful bridal lobby later in the week. Â â€œYup,â€ the Speaker sighed, â€œvacationâ€™s over.â€

title: HASBRO Threatens ISIS With Lawsuit, Claims Copyright Infringement
text:
â€œFor decades, G.I. Joe have been the â€˜Real American Heroes,â€™ and they have fought against their nemesis COBRA, a group of violent terrorists who often wear hooded masks while performing their heinous tasks,â€ said George Prime, legal spokesman for HASBRO. â€œWith the recent media coverage of the soulless terrorist group ISIS in Iraq and Syria, we were able to get a rather good look at their wardrobe, and we couldnâ€™t believe that theyâ€™dÂ resign to using COBRA costumes.â€

â€œThroughout all of it, though, we have owned the rights to names and likenesses, and that includes dark, hooded masks, at least when they are being used in a terrorist or menacing nature,â€ said Prime.
The company has sent an ultimatum to ISIS leaders to change their look, or they will bring legal action.
ISIS, short for the militant group named Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, have been waging an offensive that have seen large chunks of Northern Iraq fall out of government hands.Â ISIS is anÂ al Qaeda splinter group that wants to establish an Islamic state that would stretch fromÂ IraqÂ into northernÂ Syria.
â€œIn the G.I. Joe world, COBRA is run by an evil, shadowy figure aptly named Cobra Commander. In the real world, ISIS is also run by a shadowy operative, and although it is not 100% known if he partakes in the same dark headwear often, one can only assume that heâ€™s taking cues directly from our action figure line. We at HASBRO can only hope that they are, because in the end that means those monstrous sons of bitches will be quickly dispatched by real military heroes.â€

title: Canada Decides They Donâ€™t Want Hockey to be Their â€˜Thingâ€™ Anymore
text:

title: John Lennonâ€™s Killer Released From Prison After Shocking Reversal By Parole Board
text:
New York Corrections spokesperson Glenn Abernathy told the Associated Press in a brief statement the reasons for the reversal.
â€œAfter further consideration, we decided to grant Mr. Chapman parole. It was made clear to us by outside forcesÂ that the murder of a celebrity should not mean a longer sentence than what is typically given. In 2013, a total of 116 inmates who were found guilty of murder were released from prison after serving less than a 10-year sentence. Mr. Chapman has served nearly 33 years, more than 3-times that amount. Also, he was cleared as mentally competent many years ago, meaning that there was no reason to deny his parole in the first place.â€ said Abernathy. â€œ[Chapman] said after his initial arrest that he had plans to murder Johnny Carson, Elizabeth Taylor, Walter Cronkite, Marlon Brando, and Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, and that John Lennon was just the easiest to find. Well, everyone else he planned to kill is dead now anyway, so it was decided that he was no longer a threat toÂ anyone else.â€
â€œThe parole board are made up of old fogies,â€ said Jerome David, a self-professed â€˜super-fanâ€™ of Chapman. â€œThey denied him parole at every opportunity because they were fans of Lennon, of the Beatles, growing up. So they look at him, and they see someone who helped destroy their youth. That isnâ€™t fair to [Chapman]. He deserves to be freed just like every other murderer they set free. The Beatles are a forgotten memory, anyway. Who really cares about them or John Lennon anymore? Itâ€™s not the 60s. Personally, Iâ€™ll be waiting at the gates to wave as they drive [Chapman]Â out!â€
According to Abernathy, there was a decision made by the federal court system,Â calling the meeting with the purpose of reviewing the decision handed down on Wednesday by the parole board. It was then declared that the parole board did not have legitimate reasoning in denying the parole. The main issue discussed in the 3-hour meeting cited the fact that celebritiesÂ should not be given special treatment when the United States judicial system is involved, whether they are criminally involved or the victim.
â€œThe United States average sentence for convicted murderers is between 13 and 16 years,â€ Abernathy told the New York Associated Press.Â â€œChapman was sentenced to twenty-years to life in 1981, with a stipulation that mental health treatment be provided. â€œMr. Chapman initially did not want to be released, due to his comfort within the system. However, at approximately 6:30 am this morning, he was given $200 cash and his copy of the bookÂ Catcher In The Rye,Â which he had when he was caught at the scene of the murder, and was given instructions to move into a half-way housing unit, which at this time will not be named.â€
In an interview earlier this week, Chapman told ABC News that if released he would try to stay, anyway. â€œIâ€™m so bonded that I could probably assure you that, if released, Iâ€™d probably stay right where Iâ€™m at,â€ Chapman said. â€œYou know, once you stand on a rock for 20 years and feel the waves on you and you donâ€™t go anywhere because youâ€™re on a rock, you donâ€™t want to move.â€
Corrections officials at Wende Corrections Facility in Alden, New York, where Chapman was incarcerated, said that Chapman broke down in tears after being told of the parole board reversal. â€œHe asked if he could please stay, he said he would work for free within the prison. When told he could not, under any circumstances voluntarily stay, he broke down and said his life was over,â€ said corrections officer Alex Jameson.
Chapman is set to be transported to the half-way house on Monday morning.

title: Obama Signs Executive Order Amending Constitution, Allows Unlimited Terms As President
text:
â€œThe people of this great nation deserve a leader that works for them,â€ said President Obama in a statement from the White House. â€œThe change I promised during my first race is coming soon. It is very hard to un-do all the faults of your predecessor in only 4 short years. That is why I ran again, and you have elected me again for another 4 years. But even 8 years can sometimes not be enough time. So that is why, with the support of the U.S. Congress, I have exercised my rights of executive to sign this order, which will amend the Constitution of the United States, and allow for an unlimited number of terms as President.â€
In 1940, Franklin Roosevelt won his third term as president. After bringing the country through the Great Depression and almost all of WWII, Roosevelt became one of the most popular presidents in US history. After his third term was completed, Roosevelt actually went on to win hisÂ fourthÂ term, but died shortly afterwards. Upon his death, Congress drafted the 22nd amendment to the US Constitution, which states that a president can only serve two elected terms, for a total of 8 years.
â€œAt the time this article was written, it was important to the structure and future of this great country,â€ said President Obama. â€œThe United States had gone through tough times, and in 1947, after the death of Roosevelt, Congress decided that we needed this amendment to avoid a monarchy in this country. I am not seeking to be the King of the United States. I simply wish to try again, to run again, to continue the good work that I have done for this country.â€
President Obama said that despite the changes being made to the 22nd amendment which allow him and any future president to serve unlimited terms, it does not change the fact that the office of President must be secured by vote.
â€œEither myself or any future man or woman who serves as President of this great country may now choose to run indefinite terms, but that does not mean that the people, whom we dutifully serve, will always vote to elect the same person,â€ said Obama.
The ratification was signed into order on Friday. As of the time of this writing, President Obama had not officially announced his intentions to run for a third term in 2016, but sources from within the White House say the announcement should be made soon.

title: Paris Hilton Denied Suite at Hilton Hotel
text:
â€œIt was an oversight and we were simply filled to capacity,â€ explained hotel concierge Monique Val-de-Marne, through a translator.Â  â€œIt was quite embarrassing for us as you can well imagine.Â  We offered to provide accommodation for Miss Hilton through the courtesy of one of our competitors, which she gracefully accepted.â€
Hilton traveled to France to host an art gallery opening and to promote her second studio album featuring the single â€œCome Aliveâ€ which was released on July 8.
Produced by the record label Cash Money, a subsidiary of Universal Music Group, the music video features images of rainbows, pink, puffy clouds and unicorns, echoing Hiltonâ€™s public persona â€“ that of a young, entitled princess, spending the bulk of her time enjoying the leisurely and dream-like lifestyle that comes with fame and fortune.
â€œHilton Hotels provide unparalleled service and amenities to all of our guests,â€ said Val-de-Marne, who blamed the misstep on a staff member who did not recognize Ms. Hilton.Â  â€œWe always have a private suite set aside for what you would call VIPs,â€ she continued, â€œbut this time an oversight was made for which we take full responsibility.Â  The employee has been taken care of,â€ added Val-de-Marne, who was not working at the time of Hiltonâ€™s visit.Â  The employment status off the staff member could not be confirmed or verified, with a terse â€œNo comment!â€ issued by an unidentified reception desk staff member when reached by phone.
â€œMiss Hilton behaved quite professionally and politely from all reports,â€ remarked Val-de-Marne, â€œand we would be happy to have her visit our hotel anytime she wishes to do so.â€
No statement has been issued by representatives of Paris Hilton with regard to the incident.

After determining that the offers were legitimate, and seeing the astonishing amounts that were being offered,Â President Obama met with his cabinet and they decided that it would be an easy way to put an â€˜injection into the heart of the economy.â€™
